q: The Auburn Hills automaker sold 1.1 million cars and trucks in the U.S. last year. CEO Sergio Marchionne said last month that Chrysler expects to sell 2 million vehicles globally in 2011. They're looking at selling 1.5 million to 1.6 million vehicles in the U.S., said Bill Kelly, owner of Kelly Cars in Moon Township, Pa., near Pittsburgh. A story published Saturday said Daniels would be the odds-on favorite for the GOP nomination in 2012 if pundits, conservative columnists and political thinkers represented the party's base. The diminutive Hoosier has nurtured a profile as a mature politician whose outlook extends beyond the next news cycle and whose demeanor exudes seriousness, the story said. It also noted that the candidate favored by party elites has almost always failed to win the nomination. As for Mike Pence , a story Friday highlighted the effort by a group of conservatives
